books.title: The Little White Bird
books.author: J. M. Barrie
books.summary: A series of adventures in London, including those of the narrator and a little boy named David, and Peter Pan.

books.title: Room 13
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: A recently-released prisoner discovers that his love, the daughter of an old friend, has married a sinister imposter.

books.title: Twenty Years at Hull House
books.author: Jane Addams
books.summary: Jane Addams’ autobiographical account of the founding and operation of Hull House, one of America’s most famous settlement homes.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: Winnie-the-Pooh
books.author: A. A. Milne
books.summary: A father tells stories to his son about the son’s stuffed animals come to life.

books.title: The Conscious Lovers
books.author: Richard Steele
books.summary: A rich young man tries to avoid the marriage his father has arranged.

books.title: Henry VI, Part I
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: King Henry VI takes the throne during a time of great political division: the quarreling among English noblemen and the collapse of England’s hold in France.

books.title: The Story of the Amulet
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Four children are reunited with an ancient, magical creature and go on adventures through time with a magic amulet.

books.title: The Virginian
books.author: Owen Wister
books.summary: A cowboy working on a Wyoming Territory cattle ranch in the 1880s embraces the spirit of the American West.

books.title: The Dark Other
books.author: Stanley G. Weinbaum
books.summary: A young woman seeks the reason behind her lover’s outbursts of cruelty.

books.title: The Interesting Narrative of the Life of Olaudah Equiano
books.author: Olaudah Equiano
books.summary: An autobiography of an ex-slave in the mid 1700s.

books.title: The Man in Lower Ten
books.author: Mary Roberts Rinehart
books.summary: A young attorney is on his way to deliver evidence for a forgery case when he’s accused of killing a fellow train passenger.

books.title: Scrambles Amongst the Alps in the Years 1860–69
books.author: Edward Whymper
books.summary: A classic in early mountaineering literature, describing the first ascent of the Matterhorn and other climbs in the Alps.

books.title: The Servile State
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc’s thesis that the capitalist state breeds a collectivist theory which, in action, produces something utterly different from collectivism: the Servile State.

books.title: Pan Tadeusz
books.author: Adam Mickiewicz
books.summary: A young nobleman explores romance, feuding families, politics, and national identity during a period of social upheaval and Russian occupation.

books.title: Looking Backward
books.author: Edward Bellamy
books.summary: A man falls asleep in 1887 and wakes up over a century later in a socialist utopia.

books.title: Beyond Thirty
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: A young naval officer finds himself in a forbidden part of the world after storms waylay his ship.

books.title: The Confessions of Arsène Lupin
books.author: Maurice Leblanc
books.summary: The gentleman-thief relates stories of his outwitting the Parisian detectives.

books.title: The Pursuit of God
books.author: A. W. Tozer
books.summary: A. W. Tozer’s classic work on Christian living, containing practical advice for those who wish to know God, not simply know about Him.

books.title: Journals
books.author: Alexander Mackenzie
books.summary: Explorer Alexander Mackenzie details his journeys to both the Arctic and Pacific Oceans in his personal journals.
